decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of five years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The premises shall be used for a restaurant and for no other purpose (including any other purpose in Class A3 of the Schedule to the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987, or in any provision equivalent to that Class in any statutory instrument revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification).
Condition : 3 - No fans, louvres, ducts or other external plant shall be installed without the prior approval of the Local Planning Authority.
Condition : 4 - The use hereby permitted shall not be open to customers outside the following times 8am to 11pm Monday to Sunday.
Condition : 5 - The use hereby permitted shall be confined to sales to customers attending the premises, and shall not extend to the delivery of food or drink to customers by vehicle.

Condition : 6 - The use hereby permitted shall not be begun until details of the arrangements for storing of waste and recycled materials have been submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority.  The arrangements for storing waste and recycled materials shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with any approval given and shall be completed before any part of the accommodation hereby permitted is occupied.

Condition : 7 - The use shall not commence until a scheme for control of fumes and odours including details of sound attenuation for any necessary plant has been submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority in writing.

Condition : 8 - The use shall not commence until a scheme for the ventilation of the premises of an appropriate outlet level, including details of sound attenuation for any necessary plant and the standard or dilution expected has been submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 9 - Before development commences details of facilities for the loading, unloading and turning of vehicles clear of the public highway shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority and implemented.

Condition : 10 - The access doorway to the restaurant shall have a minimum clear width of 900mm, a level surface or ramp between the pavement and the floor and a door handle of not more than 1m above ground level.
Condition : 11 - There shall be no more than four (4) car parking spaces on the site.  These spaces shall be used by staff and residents only and not customers to the restaurant.

Condition : 12 - Before the development hereby permitted is commenced, details of the unisex disabled toilet are to be provided.  This toilet shall be designed in accordance with the requirements of Council's Think Access Guidelines in relation to design for accessibility.
Condition : 13 - The use hereby permitted shall be confined to dine in customers only.  No takeaway facilities are to be provided.

Condition : 14 - The use hereby permitted for a restaurant shall not be begun until details of a scheme to insulate the premises against the transmission of airborne and impact sound has been submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority.  Such details are to include but are not limited to a scheme for protecting the proposed residential accommodation from excessive external noise and details of a lobby area to the entrance.
description: Change of use on ground floor to A3 (food and drink), use of basement storage area, erection of single storey rear extension, external staircase to allow entrance to upper floors
